title.native: 妖怪学校の先生はじめました！
title.english: A Terrified Teacher at Ghoul School!

description:
Rookie teacher Haruaki Abe is as cowardly as they come. It's hard enough for him to handle human students without whimpering-and now he's going to be teaching at a school full of monsters?! It's a classroom of horrors for Haruaki, as his mischievous students use every means at their disposal to prank him! Will this poor teacher be able to get his group of ghouls under control, or is this class destined for failure?

(Source: Yen Press)
synonyms: คุณครูโรงเรียนปีศาจ รายงานตัวแล้วครับ!

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

node.description:
**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/katsuono)**

**Katsumi Ono** is a Japanese director, supervisor, episode director and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mariko_itoh222) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/okome2014/)

In 2008, she married fellow animator [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/Tatsufumi-Itou), who changed his name to Tatsufumi Itou after marrying her. 

Her husband passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.
Not to be confused with the [voice actor](https://anilist.co/staff/105063/Takahiro-Fujimoto).

name.native: リアルアキバボーイズ

node.description:
[Website](http://abstreem.co.jp/RAB/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RAB_CREW)

__Introduction:__
Real Akiba Boyz, alternatively known as RAB is a Japanese b-boy dance unit known for their comedic breakdancing. They call themselves the "Otaku Dancer Team" and represent the prefecture of Akihabara. They're mostly known for dancing to anime theme songs as it's their motif of choice.

__Members:__
- Suzumiya Atsuki
- Keitan
- Dragon
- Muratomi
- Maron
- Ness
- Zomayaka Janai!
- Tussy
- Ryu
- Chaka (Inactive)

__Height:__ 168 cm
__Likes:__ Winter, Video Games, Blobfish, Cats, Beef, Ramen, Cheesecake
__Dislikes:__ Summer, Corn
__Favorite Artists:__ [BUMP OF CHICKEN](https://anilist.co/staff/109225/BUMP-OF-CHICKEN), [ONE OK ROCK](https://anilist.co/staff/126954/One-Ok-Rock), [Sekai no Owari](https://anilist.co/staff/121606/Sekai-no-Owari), [YUI](https://anilist.co/staff/100287/Yui), [DOES](https://anilist.co/staff/104260/DOES) and [Porno Graffitti](https://anilist.co/staff/102716/Porno-Graffitti)

__[Website](https://sou-official.jp/)__ | __[Profile (Universal Music Japan)](https://www.universal-music.co.jp/sou/biography/)__  | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nico_nico_sou)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLAhLxCcqi5afnNTQNnfX-g)__

__Introduction:__
Sou is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist under record label Universal Music Japan (2019-), having previously been under EXIT TUNES (2015-2016) and Saihate Records (2016-2019). Prior to 2015, he was to perform as an utaite on the site Nico Nico Douga.

__Biography:__
On October 2013, he started performing as a singer on the video uploading site Nico Nico Douga. He was only 15 years old at the time. Two years later on December 2, 2015, he made his major debut with the release of his first album titled "[Suisou Regulus](https://open.spotify.com/album/1shHHMbW5b08I9HZTPIeMY)" through the record label EXIT TUNES.

After his major debut in 2015, he would release other works in collaboration with other utaite such as Nayutan, [Harumaki Gohan](https://twitter.com/harumaki_gohan) and [Eve](https://anilist.co/staff/132869/Eve), while also forming and participating in music unit "[Okaeritte Ie](https://utaite.fandom.com/wiki/Category:Okaeritte_Ie)" with utaite Wolpis Carter and Isubokuro. As of July 2019, he has accumulated over 4.5 million views on his cover of Eve's song titled "Literary Nonsense", and 13 million views on his cover of Chouchou-P's song titled "Kokoronashi". Both becoming quite popular through the tides of time.

On March 2019, he released his first song "Parade of Fools", which he himself wrote and composed, while on May of the same year, he made his first one-man live performance with "Salir" at the Akasaka Blitz in Tokyo, Japan.

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sou), edited | [Fandom (Utaite)](https://utaite.fandom.com/wiki/Sou), edited)
